chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather A Krueger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report to probation by 3:00 PM on 11/3/2016.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. Must comply with any mental health treatment and medication.   Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must report to Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: 01/13/2017 AMENDED - COURT ORDERS A MAXIMUM OF 30 DAYS JAIL. PROBATION OFFICER MAY AUTHORIZE EARLY RELEASE IF RESIDENCE IS CONFIRMED.

Defendant Heather A Krueger in court with attorney James H Krave.  Defendant Heather A Krueger in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CF89, 15CF356, 12CF323 and 12CF275 called.
15CF356 and 16CF89 Competency Hearing: Defendant claims to be competent. Dr. Donna Minter appears by telephone, sworn by Court, Direct by State, State moves for admission of Dr. Minter's report - Court receives report that is in confidential portion of the file; Cross-exam by Attorney Krave; Court questions Dr. Minter 10:18 Defendant relates 10:19 Argument by State 10:20 Argument by Attorney Krave 10:20 Defendant relates 10:21 Court relates, finds probable cause she committed the crimes, makes findings relative to competency, defendant is unable to comprehend, finds medication and treatment is likely to make competent, finds defendant is not competent.  Court suspends the proceedings and orders Defendant be committed to the Department of Health Service not to exceed 12 months.  State to prepare the Order.  Same finding on both cases.
12CF323 and 12CF275 not addressed.
Competency hearing on April 12, 2016 at 10:00 am.
